Description: Greyware pottery sherd from the shoulder of a Lesbian transport amphora, with an incised triangular motif (delta?) on the exterior surface. The mark was made at the time of production. The micaceous fabric is black in the core but grey on the surface.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Possibly from Findspot 51, domestic buildings in the urban area to the east of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp")
Curator's comments: Findspot determined by Petrie 1888. See also London, BM, EA 23772, London, PM, UC 19247 (complete) and maybe Cairo, EM, JE 27388 (lost). See also Johnston in Villing, A. and Schlotzhauer, U. (eds), Naukratis: Greek Diversity in Egypt, BM Research Publication 162, London., p. 28, Table 1, no. 6.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 61 § 58 (?), p. 64, 65, 66 § 61, pl. xxxiii.12)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 295)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.115, p.128, p.213, p.225, pl.67)
